descendant:
后裔；后代；子孙 
a person's descendants are their children, their children's children, and all the people who 
live after them who are related to them

由过去类似物发展来的派生物 
something that has developed from something similar in the past
transcendent:
卓越的；杰出的；极其伟大的 
going beyond the usual limits; extremely great
futile:
徒劳的 
having no result or effect; pointless or useless
blunder:
因愚蠢或粗心等造成的错误，失误 
a bad mistake made because of stupidity or carelessness
outwit:
以智取胜 
to defeat or trick (someone) by being more intelligent or clever; outsmart
assassinate:
刺杀，暗杀，行刺 
to kill (someone, such as a famous or important person) usually for political reasons
credulity:
轻信 
ability or willingness to believe something
burthen:
负荷；载重量；重荷；负担 
old form of burden
resume:
恢复 
to return to or begin (something) again after interruption
consonant:
辅音；子音 
a speech sound made by completely or partly stopping the flow of air being breathed out 
through the mouth
negligence:
疏忽；失职；失误；过失 
the failure to give somebody/something enough care or attention
flicker:
灯光等闪烁，摇曳 
to burn or glow in an unsteady way; to produce an unsteady light

闪现，一闪而过 
to appear or pass briefly or quickly
taint:
污点 
something that causes a person or thing to be thought of as bad, dishonest, etc.

玷污，破坏 
to make (something) dangerous or dirty especially by adding something harmful or 
undesirable to it 
231
servitude:
奴役 
the condition of being a slave or of having to obey another person
repulsive:
令人反感的 
causing strong dislike or disgust
pervasive:
普遍的，流行的 
existing in every part of something; spreading to all parts of something
pulp:
浆状物 
a soft wet substance that is made especially by crushing something

纸浆 
a soft substance that is made by crushing wood, fabric or other material and then used to make paper

瓜果等的肉质部份，髓 
the soft part inside some fruit and vegetables

将…捣成浆 
to crush or beat something so that it becomes soft and wet

书刊等粗制滥造的；庸俗刺激的 
(of books, magazines, etc.) badly written and often intended to shock people
align:
排整齐；校准； 尤指使成一条直线 
to arrange something in the correct position, or to be in the correct position, in relation to 
something else, especially in a straight line

使一致 
to change something slightly so that it is in the correct relationship to something else
wrestle:
摔跤 
to fight (someone) by holding and pushing instead of by hitting, kicking, or punching

艰苦奋斗 
to engage in or as if in a violent or determined struggle
chronological:
按时间的前后顺序排列的 
arranged in the order that things happened or came to be
circumscribe:
限制 
to limit the size or amount of (something)
gnaw:
困扰 
to be a source of worry or concern to (someone)

啮咬 
to bite or chew (something) repeatedly
mollify:
平息 
to make (someone) less angry; to calm (someone) down 
232
apparition:
鬼魂 
a ghost or spirit of a dead person

特异景象等的出现 
an unusual or unexpected sight
supplemental:
补充的 
added to something else to make it complete
unflinching:
不妥协的，坚定的 
staying strong and determined even when things are difficult
prosaic:
枯燥的；乏味的；平淡无奇的 
dull or ordinary
foreground:
景物、图画等的前景 
the part of a view that is nearest to the observer, especially in a picture or photograph

瞩目地位；重要位置 
an important position that is noticed by people

强调；突出 
to give particular importance to something
impotent:
无能的 
lacking power or strength
hail:
打招呼，喊 
to call out in order to stop or get the attention of (someone or something)

称赞 
to speak of or welcome (someone or something) with praise or enthusiasm
stingy:
吝啬的 
not liking or wanting to give or spend money
afresh:
重新地 
from a new beginning
eloquent:
雄辩的 
having or showing the ability to use language clearly and effectively
intercept:
拦截，窃听 
to stop and take someone or something that is going from one place to another place before that person or thing gets there
relate:
叙述，讲述 
to give an account of; tell 
233
confessional:
忏悔的，自白的 
telling private thoughts or past incidents, especially ones that cause shame or embarrassment in one's life

忏悔室，告解室 
a private place inside a church where a priest hears confessions
capricious:
任性的，反复无常的，变幻莫测的 
showing sudden changes in attitude or behaviour; changing suddenly and quickly
contaminate:
污染 
to make (something) dangerous, dirty, or impure by adding something harmful or 
undesirable to it
arrest:
吸引注意 
to attract and hold the attention of (someone or something)
sovereign:
有主权的 
having independent authority and the right to govern itself

人、机构等拥有最高统治权的 
having unlimited power or authority
unanimous:
一致的 
agreed to by everyone
artifice:
诡计 
dishonest or insincere behavior or speech that is meant to deceive someone
mellow:
颜色或声音柔和的 
pleasantly rich, full, or soft; not harsh, bright, or irritating

变成熟理性 
to become or to cause (someone or something) to become less harsh, irritating, nervous, 
etc.
sly:
狡猾的 
clever in a dishonest way
juggle:
玩抛接杂耍 
to keep several objects in motion in the air at the same time by repeatedly throwing and 
catching them

尽量兼顾 
to do (several things) at the same time
flora:
尤指某个地区的植物群 
all the plants that live in a particular area, time, period, or environment 
234
heredity:
遗传 
the natural process by which physical and mental qualities are passed from a parent to a child
prowl:
偷偷潜行 
to move quietly through an area while hunting
nullify:
使无效 
to make (something) legally null
furnace:
火炉 
an enclosed container in which heat is produced
stereotypical:
老一套的 
relating to a widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of 
person or thing
inadvertent:
不经意的 
not intended or planned
stampede:
使 争先恐后地奔逃； 使 惊逃 
to run away in a large group from something especially because of fear

人群的蜂拥，狂奔； 动物的惊逃，乱窜 
an occurrence in which a large group of frightened or excited animals or people run 
together in a wild and uncontrolled way to escape from something, get out of a place, etc.
malleable:
延展性好的 
capable of being stretched or bent into different shapes

易受别人影响的 
capable of being easily changed or influenced
prick:
刺，扎，戳 
to cause a sharp, painful feeling on or in (part of your body)

刺痛 
a feeling of pain caused by being touched by something sharp or pointed
proximity:
时间或空间接近，邻近，靠近 
the state of being near somebody/something in distance or time
revel:
陶醉于，沉湎于，狂欢 
to enjoy (something) very much
fugitive:
逃亡者；逃跑者；亡命者 
a person who has escaped or is running away from somewhere and is trying to avoid being caught

逃亡的；逃跑的 
trying to avoid being caught 
235
lust:
强烈的愿望，渴望 
a strong desire for something

强烈欲望 
a strong feeling of sexual desire
coil:
环，圈 
a long thin piece of material (such as a wire, string, or piece of hair) that is wound into circles

盘绕 
to wind (something) into circles
testament:
证据；证明 
a thing that shows that something else exists or is true
fission:
分裂，裂变 分裂生殖 
a splitting or breaking up into parts
insurmountable:
不能克服的 
impossible to solve or get control of; impossible to overcome
misgiving:
疑虑，担心 
a feeling of doubt about something; a feeling that something might not be right or might 
not work as planned
notch:
等级；档次；位阶 
a level on a scale, often marking quality or achievement

表面或边缘的 形刻痕，圆形切口 
a V-shaped or circular cut in an edge or a surface, sometimes used to keep a record of something

赢取；获得 
to achieve something such as a win or a high score
slump:
沉重或突然地落下 
to sit or fall down suddenly and heavily

大幅度下降，暴跌 
to decrease suddenly and by a large amount
provision:
规定 
a condition that is included as part of an agreement or law

提供 
to supply (someone or something) with provisions and especially with food 
236
microscopic:
用显微镜的 
done with a microscope

极小的 
much smaller than what is usual, normal, or expected
stipulate:
规定，约定 
to demand or require (something) as part of an agreement
senate:
参议院 
the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make 
laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France
patchy:
零散的；散落的；分布不匀的 
existing or happening in some places and not others

不完整的；参差不齐的 
not complete; good in some parts, but not in others
buffer:
缓冲物 
something that gives protection by separating things

缓冲 
to lessen the harmful effects of (something)
savvy:
有见识的；具有实际知识的，有经验的 
having practical understanding or knowledge of something

悟性，见识；实际知识 
practical understanding or knowledge of something
tint:
少许色彩 
a small amount of color

给…略微着色 
to give a small amount of color to (something)
enshrine:
把 法律、权利等奉为神圣；把…庄严地载入 
to make a law, right, etc. respected or official, especially by stating it in an important 
written document
gist:
要点，主旨 
the general or basic meaning of something said or written
doting:
溺爱的；宠爱的 
showing a lot of love for somebody, often ignoring their faults
disposed:
乐意于…的； 态度、看法 有…倾向的 
wanting to do something or likely to do something; feeling or thinking in a specified way 
about something 
237
intermittent:
断断续续的 
starting, stopping, and starting again; not constant or steady
anthem:
圣歌，赞美诗 
a formal song of loyalty, praise, or happiness
